line_1: But Phoebus' beams the captive swain releas'd,
line_2: The chilling frost his tender form had seiz'd,

line_1: Into his Ark; I would have some releast
line_2: For all to enter Beds, like Noah's beast

line_1: From yokes of Goodness, thou'st thy self releast,
line_2: Turn'd Bully Hector, and a humane Beast.

line_1: Till dying both are from their Pains releast.
line_2: Gaunch'd on the Tenters of the prickly Beast;

line_1: That had the courteous knight not soon released
line_2: She must have sunk by his rough jaws opprest:

line_1: Come here, from baleful cares releas'd,
line_2: With Virtue's ticket, to a feast,

line_1: Oft shall he wish himself from thought releast;
line_2: Shall gild the glitt'rand portals of the east,

line_1: Oft shall he wish himself from thought releast;
line_2: And seek around the isle the blatant-beast:

line_1: Oft shall he wish himself from thought releast;
line_2: Mean while in buxom mirth they spend the feast.

line_1: His senses from the heav'nly trance releas'd,
line_2: And all the sacred agitation ceas'd.

line_1: When all their Earthly Train's releas'd;
line_2: My self attend on the Deceas'd,

line_1: But leisure, silence, and a mind releas'd
line_2: From anxious thoughts how wealth may be encreas'd,

line_1: Till we from Bands of Clay releas'd
line_2: Sweet Soul, we leave thee to thy Rest,
'Till by Thy Hand in proper Atoms dress'd,

line_1: But TABBY from Scruples of Mind is releas'd,
line_2: Since she met with a learned MORAVIAN Priest,

line_1: Six solid Months (an Age) they live, releas'd
line_2: With Plenty for the coming Season blest,

line_1: WE deem the Saints, from mortal Flesh releas'd,
line_2: With brighter Day, and bolder Raptures blest:
